alert.note: Alert for Butler; Chase; Harvey; Marion; Sedgwick (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued October 25 at 6:44AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Another round of excessive rainfall is possible, especially through the morning hours which may result in flooding. * WHERE...Portions of Central and South Central Kansas, including the following counties, in Central Kansas, Chase and Marion. In South Central Kansas, Butler, Harvey and Sedgwick. * WHEN...Through this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy rain fell across portions of central and south central Kansas overnight and another round of heavy rain may develop today before diminishing toward evening.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
